            }

                }
            }
        } else {
            console.warn('No prebid winners');
        }
    }

        sendAdserverRequest();

<div class="modal-footer">
<button class="btn btn-default pull-left" data-dismiss="modal" type="button">Cancel</button>
<button class="btn btn-primary pull-right" type="submit">Confirm</button>
</div>

</form>
<script>
    $(function(){
       var zipcodes = [];

       $.each($('.subscription-services .subscription-service.subscription-service-delivered'),function(){
           $(this).find('.service-sublink a.btn.btn-primary').on('click',function(){
               $('#zipcode-restriction').find('input[name=serviceid]').val($(this).attr('data-subscription-service'));
               zipcodes = $(this).attr('data-subscription-service-zipcodes').split(',');

               $('#template-metering').find('.metering-modal').modal('toggle');
               $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.modal').modal({});

               return false;
           });
       });


       $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.zipcode-restriction-modal').on('click',function(){
           $('#template-metering').find('.metering-modal').modal('toggle');
           $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.modal').modal({
               static:'static',
               keyboard:false
            });

            return false;
       });


       $('#zipcode-restriction').on('submit',function(){
           if($('#zipcode-restriction').find('[name=zipcode]').val()!=""){

               if($.inArray($('#zipcode-restriction').find('[name=zipcode]').val(), zipcodes) > -1){
                   console.log("form is valid, should submit");
               }else{
                   console.log("form is catching on zipcode check");

                   $('#zipcode-restriction').find('.zipcode-restriction-warning').removeClass('hidden').show();

                   return false;
               }
           } else {
               console.log("form is catching on zipcode blank check");
               return false;
           }
       });
    });
</script>
<script type="text/javascript">
    $(function(){
        var i = 0;
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services').find('.subscription-service').each(function(){
            $(this).attr('id','service-tab-'+i);
        
            $(this).find('.panel-heading h3').html('<a href="" data-toggle="collapse" data-parent="services-modal-collapsable-tabs" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="service-tab-'+i+'">'+$(this).find('.panel-heading h3').text()+'</a>')
            $(this).find('.panel-body').addClass('panel-collapse collapse').attr('role','tabpanel');
            
            if(i==0){
                $(this).find('.panel-collapse').collapse('show');
                $(this).find('.panel-footer').show();
            }else{
                $(this).find('.panel-footer').hide();
            }
        
            i++;
        });
    
        $('.subscription-services-filter').hide();
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service .service-heading').css({'padding':'0px'});
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service .service-heading').find('a').css({'display':'block','padding':'10px 15px'});
        $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service .service-heading').find('a[data-toggle=collapse]').on('click',function(event){
            var id = $(this).attr('aria-controls');
            var open = $('#'+id).find('.collapse').hasClass('in');
            
            $('#subscription-modal').find('.subscription-services .subscription-service').each(function(){
                if(this.id == id){
                    $(this).find('.panel-collapse').collapse('show');
                    $(this).find('.panel-footer').show();
                }else{
                    $(this).find('.panel-collapse').collapse('hide');
                    $(this).find('.panel-footer').hide();
                }
            });
        });
        
        $('#asset-content').find('.subscription-required').find('.panel-footer').find('a[data-toggle=collapse]').on('click',function(event){
            $(this).parents('.panel-footer').find('.collapse.collapse-rates').collapse('toggle');
        });
        
        
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter-modal-open').on('click',function(){
            $('#asset-content').find('.alert.notification').css({'z-index':'900'});
            $("#template-metering").find('.metering-modal').first().modal();
        
        });
        
    });
    
</script>
</div>

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<style>#ndn-video-player-1.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container p402_hide">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="91757" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-1"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>
</div>
<style>#ndn-video-player-2.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container p402_hide">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="91757" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-2"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>
</div>
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Ventnor residents were advised to boil their water Friday, after
test results showed fecal coliform traces — E. coli bacteria — in
the city’s drinking water.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>That boil-water advisory will continue through this afternoon at
the earliest, as city officials await a new round of test
results.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Thomas Klein, superintendent of the city’s Water and Sewer
Utility, said the drinking water contamination was unrelated to a
ruptured sewage line at the intersection of Fulton and Harvard
avenues in the city’s Ventnor Heights section.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1371136"><div class="block-title title-000111 ">
<div class="block-title-inner">
<h4>
                
               Latest Video
                
            </h4>
</div>
</div>
<div class="inform-embed" data-aspect-ratio="4:3" data-playlist-id="15261" data-tracking-group="91757" data-type="InView" data-width="100%"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _informq = _informq || [];
  _informq.push(['embed']);</script></div></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“There’s no correlation between one incident and the other,
other than the fact that they occurred in the same time window,” he
said, adding that the pressurized water system is completely
separate from the sewer.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Officials urged residents to avoid recreational activities in
the bays or canals around Ventnor, including harvesting shellfish
from Lakes Bay north of the Margate Bridge.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Klein, at the scene of the line break, said he found out
Wednesday that an inflatable plug designed to prevent sewage from
entering an abandoned subterranean pipe that ruptured three years
ago had failed. The seal was compromised when the sewer main
crumbled around it, allowing untreated waste to spill into the
water off Ventnor Heights.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Meanwhile, test results Klein received Friday morning revealed
that one of nine samples collected from sites across the city
Wednesday tested positive for coliform bacteria, later confirmed as
E. coli, he said. He declined to say which site tested
positive.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It wouldn’t matter where the test came from because the water
mains are all connected,” he said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Escherichia coli, or E. coli, is a bacteria commonly found in
the waste of animals and humans that can cause severe
gastrointestinal illness.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>After being informed of the results, Klein said he notified
state officials and took eight additional samples downstream and
upstream from the contamination site.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>He said the results should be be returned between 5 and 7 p.m.
today. If no additional coliform is found, he said the state
Department of Environmental Protection may rescind the boiling
order. If the tests are again positive, officials will continue
collecting water samples, trying to trace the source of the
bacteria.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The situation had residents and officials on edge Friday.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It’s a panic situation,” said City Commissioner Stephen
Weintrob, also at the scene of the sewer line break.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>While the public was advised via reverse-911 calls and emails
starting at about 4:30 p.m. Friday, Weintrob acknowledged officials
should have acted faster.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“Someone has to make these decisions at an elected level at a
quicker pace,” Weintrob said. “We should have gotten the word out
this morning.”</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Resident Bob DePiano, 83, shared that sentiment.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“On the phone, they said it’s happened since the 27th,” he said.
“I take pills with this water, and I have collitis.”</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Carol Kahn, who lives next to the breached sewer pipe, said the
temporary pumping station has been an irksome presence in her
neighborhood for three years before the latest incident.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It doesn’t seem like it’s ever going to go away,” she said.
“When’s it going to be over?”</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>And the water contamination only makes the situation worse, Kahn
said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It’s skeeved me out,” she said, holding her 6-year-old Cocker
Spaniel Scooter’s leash. “I’ve been boiling water for my dog.”</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The news drove residents and visitors to buy up bottled water at
local stores.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1349560">
<div class="tnt-ads-container text-center ">
<div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-refreshable="true" id="ad-1349560" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;">
<script>
                    googletag.cmd.push(function() {
                        googletag.display('ad-1349560');
                        
                    });
                </script>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It’s kind of a panic. Nobody feels like boiling water, they’d
rather buy it,” said Salma Azad, owner of New Dorset Market on
Dorset Avenue.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Within an hour of the announcement, Azad said, he was out of
bottled water and had to buy more from an offshore site, reselling
it at a premium.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Red Room Cafe owner Maria Gatta said she had four cancellations
from hesitant diners Friday.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“Something like this scares people away,” she said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>While dinner service commenced Friday, the restaurant didn’t
serve anything that required ice or water, including coffee and
soda.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Like many business owners, Gatta said she’s frustrated by the
seemingly endless list of new problems facing Ventnor, including
Dorset Avenue bridge closures and flooding along West End
Avenue.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>“It just seems like there’s always something going on here we’ve
got to deal with,” she said. “There was the bridge, and now this
water situation.”</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p><em>Staff writer Steven Lemongello contributed to this
report.</em></p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Contact Wallace McKelvey:</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>609-272-7256</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p><a href="mailto:WMcKelvey@pressofac.com">WMcKelvey@pressofac.com</a></p>
</div><script type="text/javascript">
      var _informq = _informq || [];
      _informq.push(['hook', 'ndn-video-player-3/videoLoad', function(event) { 
        jQuery("#ndn-video-player-3").addClass("bh_ndn_background"); 
      }]);
    </script><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1484856"><form action="http://bhmedia.whatcounts.com/bin/listctrl" id="newsletter_morning" method="POST">

<p>VENTNOR — The city announced Sunday morning
that its water was  safe to drink, after a new round of testing
indicated no traces of fecal colif…</p>

<div class="asset-related-article parent-article inline-asset"><article class="clearfix card summary " id="card-summary-bd8297c6-bb73-11e0-a956-001cc4c03286">
<div class="card-container">
<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h3 class="">

<div class="card-lead">

city's drinking water is again safe for residents to use.

            $(window).load(function() {

                var bizTracked = [];
                var isUserAction = false;

                function trackActive(owl){
                    if( bizTracked.length == 4 ){
                        return;
                    }else{
                        var activeThings = $(owl).find('.owl-item.active');

                        $.each(activeThings, function(index, value){
                            var bizId = $(this).find('.card').data('bizid');
                            var hasBeenLogged = false;

                            bizTracked.forEach(function (item, index, array) {
                                if(item == bizId){
                                    hasBeenLogged = true;
                                    return true;
                                }
                            });
                            if( hasBeenLogged == false ){
                                bizTracked.push(bizId);
                                TNCMS.Tracking.addEvent({
                                    app: 'business',
                                    metric: 'block',
                                    id: bizId
                                });
                            }
                        });
                    }
                }

                window.card_carousel_1260694 = $('#block-1260694 .owl-carousel');

                card_carousel_1260694.on('initialized.owl.carousel', function(e){
                        trackActive(card_carousel_1260694);
                    });
                

                card_carousel_1260694.owlCarousel({
                    loop:true,
                    margin:15,
                    nav:false,
                    dots:false,
                    slideBy: 'page',
                    autoHeight:false,
                    
                    responsiveClass:true,
                    responsive:{
                        0:{
                            items:1,
                            stagePadding: 40,
                            nav:false
                        },
                        600:{
                            items:4
                        },
                        1000:{
                            items:2
                        }
                    }
                });

                // bind previous click
                $('#block-1260694 .owl-carousel-control.prev').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, function(e){
                    e.stopPropagation();
                    card_carousel_1260694.trigger('prev.owl.carousel');

                    isUserAction = true;
                    trackActive(card_carousel_1260694);
                });

                // bind next click
                $('#block-1260694 .owl-carousel-control.next').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, function(e){
                    e.stopPropagation();
                    card_carousel_1260694.trigger('next.owl.carousel');

                    isUserAction = true;
                    trackActive(card_carousel_1260694);
                });

                // bind dragged
                card_carousel_1260694.on('dragged.owl.carousel', function(event){
                    isUserAction = true;
                    trackActive(card_carousel_1260694);
                });

                // bind translated
                card_carousel_1260694.on('translated.owl.carousel', function(event){
                    if( isUserAction ){
                        trackActive(card_carousel_1260694);
                        isUserAction = false;
                    }
                });
            });
        </script>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {

                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });

<script>/*<![CDATA[*/ jQuery(document).ready(function($){
        var aChecked = [],
            urlParams = '/search/?l=25&unrolled=1&s=start_time&sd=asc&f=html',

            $wrapper = $( '#block-1262661 .fc-inner' ),
            $calendar = $( '#calendar-1262661' ),
            cal = $calendar.calendario({
                displayWeekAbbr: true,
                startIn: 0,
                onDayClick: function( $el, $contentEl, dateProperties ) {
                    window.location = $('#block-1262661 .url-template').attr('href') + urlParams + '&d1=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date') + '&d2=' + $el.find('.fc-date').data('date');
                }
            }),
            $month = $( '#block-1262661 .fc-month' ).html( cal.getMonthName() ),
            $year = $( '#block-1262661 .fc-year' ).html( cal.getYear() );


        $('#block-1262661 .fc-next').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoNextMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        $('#block-1262661 .fc-prev').on('click', function() {
            cal.gotoPreviousMonth(updateMonthYear);
        });
        function updateMonthYear(){
            $month.html(cal.getMonthName());
            $year.html(cal.getYear());
            fetchDays();
        }
        function fetchDays(){
            if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                $.ajax({
                    type: 'GET',
                    dataType: 'json',
                    url: $('#block-1262661 .url-template').attr('href') + '/search/?year='+cal.getYear()+'&month='+cal.getMonth()+'&fmt=json',
                    cache: true,
                    success: function(data) {
                        $.each(data, function(index, value){
                            if(value.result.numEvents > 0){
                                sMonth = value.result.month.toString();
                                if(sMonth.length < 2){ sMonth = '0'+sMonth }
                                sDay = value.result.day.toString();
                                if(sDay.length < 2){ sDay = '0'+sDay }
                                sString = sMonth + '-' + sDay + '-' + value.result.year;

                                oNumEvents = {};

                                var iOneDot = 1,
                                    iTwoDots = 2,
                                    iThreeDots = 3;

                                oNumEvents[sString] = '<div class="fc-data-item">';
                                if( value.result.numEvents > 0 && value.result.numEvents < iOneDot+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> ';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iOneDot && value.result.numEvents < iTwoDots+1 ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }else if( value.result.numEvents > iTwoDots ){
                                    oNumEvents[sString] += '<i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i> <i class="fa fa-circle"></i>';
                                }
                                oNumEvents[sString] += '</div>';

                                cal.setData(oNumEvents);
                            }
                        });

                        if( aChecked.indexOf(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth()) == -1 ){
                            aChecked.push(cal.getYear() + '-' + cal.getMonth());
                        }
                    },
                    error: function(response) {
                        __tnt.log(response.status);
                    }
                });
            }
        }
        fetchDays();
    }); /*]]>*/</script>

Some Gladewater residents without water, under boil order

From Staff Reports
Aug. 6, 2011 at 7:56 a.m.


Gladewater residents who live south of U.S. 80 should boil their water until further notice, according to the police department.

A water main break earlier today on U.S. 271 left residents south of U.S. 80 without water, and crews are working to repair the main, police said.

Veolia Water informed the police department that once water is restored, residents should be advised to boil water for cooking, drinking and making ice until further notice.

Lexington boil water order lifted

LEXINGTON, AL (WAFF) -

A boil water advisory for the town of Lexington has been lifted.

Residents were asked to boil water before using it after lightning struck a pipeline during severe thunderstorms.

The tank was emptied when lightning struck the pipeline during Thursday morning's thunderstorms.

Crews repaired the pipe and the water test came back alright.
